an6.73:1.1: “Bhikkhus, having not given up these six things, it’s impossible to abide having entered upon the first jhāna.
an6.73:1.3: Sensual desire, ill will, indolence-and-lethargy, restlessness-and-anxiety, and doubt.
an6.73:1.4: And the woe in sensuality hasn’t been seen clearly as it is with right understanding.
an6.73:1.5: Not having given up these six things, it’s impossible to abide having entered upon the first jhāna.
an6.73:2.1: Bhikkhus, having given up these six things, it is possible to abide having entered upon the first jhāna.
an6.73:2.3: Sensual desire, ill will, indolence-and-lethargy, restlessness-and-anxiety, and doubt.
an6.73:2.4: And the woe in sensuality hasn’t been seen clearly as it is with right understanding.
an6.73:2.5: Having given up these six things, it is possible to abide having entered upon the first jhāna.
